title: Laws About Vows and Dedications
summary: Leviticus 27 concludes the book with laws about making vows to God. It explains how people, animals, houses, and land vowed to God could be redeemed with a payment. Tithes and certain gifts are sacred and belong to the Lord.

faq.question: What happens when someone dedicates something to the Lord?
faq.answer: It can be redeemed by paying a specified value plus 20%, unless it is something devoted permanently.

faq.question: Are tithes redeemable?
faq.answer: Yes, but only with an additional fifth of their value.
